squidpony.squidmath

Class CosmicNumbering

  • java.lang.Object
    • squidpony.squidmath.CosmicNumbering
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class CosmicNumbering
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Like a kind of RNG, but fully deterministic in a way that depends on certain connected variables. Intended as a way to produce similar values when small changes occur in the connections, while potentially producing larger changes when the changes are more significant (unlike an RNG or hashing function, which can and should produce very different output given even slightly different seeds/input). This might be useful to produce procedural story data that is similar when most of the connected inputs are similar, or for terrain generation/population. This can produce ints and doubles, and does not produce a different output unless its input is changed (usually by altering a shared reference to connections).
    Created by Tommy Ettinger on 5/18/2017.
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • getConnections

        public double[] getConnections()

      • setConnections

        public void setConnections(double[] connections)

      • getDoubleBase

        public final double getDoubleBase()
        Gets a double determined by the current values in the connections, accessible via getConnections(). Returns a value between -1.0 and 1.0 (exclusive on 1.0). Used as the basis for other methods in this class.
        Returns:
        a double between -1.0 and 1.0; will be the same value until/unless connections change

      • getDouble

        public double getDouble()
        Gets a double determined by the current values in the connections, accessible via getConnections(). Returns a value between 0.0 and 1.0 (exclusive on 1.0).
        Returns:
        a double between 0.0 and 1.0; will be the same value until/unless connections change

      • getInt

        public int getInt()
        Gets an int determined by the current values in the connections, accessible via getConnections(). Returns a value in the full range of ints, but is less likely to produce ints close to Integer.MAX_VALUE or Integer.MIN_VALUE (expect very few values in the bottom and top quarters of the range).
        Returns:
        an int which can be positive or negative; will be the same value until/unless connections change

      • determine

        public static long determine(long state)
        The same as LinnormRNG.determine(long), except this assumes state has already been multiplied by 0x632BE59BD9B4E019L.
        Parameters:
        state - a long that should change in increments of 0x632BE59BD9B4E019L
        Returns:
        a pseudo-random permutation of state
